attributes.description:
During garage construction, 592 spots at the North Quincy Hancock Street lot will be unavailable. More than 600 spots will be available in two surface lots: 
350 spots at Newport Avenue lot 
260 spots at Hancock Street lot 

On weekdays, the Hancock Street lot typically fills by about 7:30 AM, and the Newport Avenue lot fills between 7:45 & 8 AM.

Alternative parking and travel options include: 
403 spots at Wollaston Station during the station closure, with free shuttle service between North Quincy, Quincy Center, and Wollaston Stations.

For more information visit: www.mbta.com/northquincy

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428.  

For the Route 111, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Customers may show their CharlieCard to the conductor for travel between Chelsea and North Station, a 10-minute trip. Parking is not available at Chelsea Station. 

Silver Line - SL3: SL3 connects to the Blue Line (via Airport Station), Red Line (via South Station), and the Commuter Rail at Chelsea Station, along with other Silver Line routes. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Inbound SL3 fares are being waived from Chelsea, Bellingham Square, Box District, and Eastern Ave during construction. 

Subway: For Blue Line service, take bus Routes 114, 116, or 117 to Maverick or the SL3 to Airport Station. For Red Line, take the SL3 to South Station. For Orange Line, take the Routes 110 or 112 to Wellington. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Monthly local bus passes are not accepted on SL3 or subway. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Beginning at 10:00 PM on May 13, delays on the Route 111 bus are expected to increase due to additional lane closures on Route 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek alternate routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge
attributes.short_header: Beginning at 10pm on May 13, delays on the Rt. 111 are expected to increase due to additional lane closures on Rt. 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin

attributes.description:
Bus shuttles between Malden Center and Ballardvale will operate on a dedicated schedule; please visit https://www.mbta.com/HVLwork for more information. Passengers may also use local MBTA bus service #136/137

Passengers should allow approximately 20 minutes of travel between North Station and Malden Center utilizing the subway. 

Bikes are not allowed on bus shuttles. 

Passengers travelling inbound :

-Passengers travelling to Boston from Haverhill, Bradford, Lawrence, Andover and Ballardvale will board the regularly scheduled trains and will travel express from Ballardvale to North Station. 

-Passengers travelling to Boston from North Wilmington, Reading, Wakefield, Greenwood, Melrose Highlands, Melrose/Cedar Park or Wyoming Hill will board the dedicated bus shuttle up to Malden center for a Subway connection on the Orange line. We also recommend the MBTA local bus service (#136/137) making all stops between Reading and Malden Center.

Passengers travelling outbound:

-Passengers travelling from Boston to Ballardvale, Andover, Lawrence, Bradford and Haverhill will take the regularly scheduled train that will operate express on the Lowell line to Ballardvale and then make all local stops to Haverhill. 

-Passengers travelling outbound from Boston to Wyoming Hill, Melrose/Cedar Park, Melrose Highlands, Greenwood, Wakefield, Reading and North Wilmington must take the subway to Malden Center for a free bus shuttle connection. We also recommend the MBTA local bus service (#136/137) making all stops between Reading and Malden Center.

Interzone trips:

-Passengers travelling inbound from Haverhill, Bradford, Lawrence, Andover and Ballardvale to North Wilmington, reading, Wakefield, Greenwood, Melrose Highlands, Melrose/Cedar Park or Wyoming Hill will deboard the regularly scheduled train at Ballardvale to take a bus shuttle making all local stops to Malden Center. We also recommend the MBTA local bus service (#136/137) making all stops between Reading and Malden Center.

-Passengers travelling outbound from Wyoming Hill, Melrose/Cedar Park, Melrose Highlands, Greenwood, Wakefield, Reading or North Wilmington will board the dedicated bus shuttle and connect to the Commuter Rail at Ballardvale.We also recommend the MBTA local bus service (#136/137) making all stops between Reading and Malden Center.

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, the Route 1 northbound lane closure will be extended through Chelsea and a southbound lane on the Tobin Bridge will be closed effective May 13. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428. 

For the Routes 426 & 428, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Lynn Station (Zone 2 fare) is a 20-minute trip to North Station and daily parking is available for $2. 

Bus Routes: Inner Express Bus Routes 424, 434, 450, 459 or local bus Route 455 connect to downtown Boston and the Orange & Green Lines. Monthly Inner Express Bus passes are valid on these routes and local bus routes/subway. 

Subway: For the Orange Line, take the Route 430 bus from Saugus to Malden Center. For the Blue Line, take local bus Routes 110, 116, 117, 411, 429, 441, 442, 455 or Inner Express Routes 426W, 448 or 449 to Wonderland Station. Monthly Inner Express Bus pass valid for travel on subway and local bus. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Beginning at 10:00 PM on May 13, delays on the Routes 426 & 428 are expected to increase due to additional lane closures on Route 1 in Chelsea & the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek other routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge
attributes.short_header: Beginning at 10pm May 13, delays on Rts. 426 & 428 are expected to increase due to addt'l lane closures on Rt. 1 in Chelsea & Tobin Bridge

attributes.description:
Orange Line travel alternates between Haymarket and Tufts MC:
- Transfer is available to the Green Line at North Station and Haymarket
- Take the Green Line to Copley and walk to Back Bay for Forest Hills-bound Orange Line train service
- SL 5 and Route 10 (Bayview-Downtown) provide inbound service from Tufts MC to Chinatown and Downtown Crossing 
- SL 5 provides outbound service from Downtown Crossing (Temple Place) to Tufts MC

Additional Information:
Diversion begins at 8:45 PM on Fridays and at all times on Saturdays and Sundays. Regularly scheduled service begins at the start of service on Mondays. 

All bus shuttles and stops fully accessible. Please see an MBTA employee at any station for assiatnce and visit MBTA.com/buildingabettert or MBTA.com/olimprovement for more.

Regular weekend train service will resume on Saturday, October 19th. Learn more about this outage on https://www.mbta.com/NDMwork 

To get around on the Needham Line during construction, please utilize the following connecting bus/subway service: 

-From Needham Heights, Needham Center, and Needham Junction, the Route 59 bus service connects to Newton Highlands on the Green Line D Branch and to Watertown Square. 

-From West Roxbury, Highland, Bellevue, and Roslindale Village, Bus Routes 35, 36, and 37 connect to and from Forest Hills on the Orange Line, offering connections to Ruggles and Back Bay. 

-Customers who typically board at Hersey Station are encouraged to travel to Needham Junction or West Roxbury Station, as there are no connecting MBTA services at Hersey.

Please note that the Needham line normally does not have Sunday service. 

Learn more about PTC on the MBTA website : https://www.mbta.com/projects/commuter-rail-positive-train-control-ptc

attributes.description:
Please visit https://www.mbta.com/FRKwork for more details about bus shuttle schedules. Visit MBTA.com/PTC for more information on how this project will improve commuter rail safety and travel.

There will be no Franklin line service at Back Bay and Ruggles stations on weekends. Please travel to South Station to reach a Franklin Line station. If you are travelling inbound, please board a Worcester/Framingham line Train for direct connection to Back Bay or a Providence/Stoughton line Train for a direct connection to Back Bay or Ruggles. 

We also recommend the subway: board the Red Line at South Station and transfer to the Orange Line at Downtown Crossing to reach Back Bay or Ruggles.

Due to proximity of adjacent stations, bus shuttles will not serve Endicott, Islington and Norwood Depot stations:
-Endicott station customers, please use Readville or Dedham Corp stations.
-Islington station customers, please use Dedham Corp station.
-Norwood Depot customers, please use Norwood Central or Dedham Corp station. 

8:40pm and 10:40pm departures from Forge Park as well as 11:20pm departure from South Station will be accommodated by a bus for the entire trip between South Station and Forge Park (including the portion between South Station and Readville).

Additional weekends may be added to the train service suspension between Forge Park/495 and Readville as work progresses on the Franklin line. 

Thank you for your patience while we improve the signal system on your Commuter Rail line.
attributes.header: Weekends, Sept 7- Nov 24, Franklin Train service is replaced by free buses between Forge Park/495 and Readville for a Fairmount Line connection while PTC is installed. There will be no service at Back Bay, Ruggles, Endicott, Islington and Norwood Depot.

attributes.description:
Normal service will operate October 5th and 6th but additional weekends may be added to the train diversion between Porter Square and North Station as work progresses on the Green Line Extension project. 

Learn more about the project on mbta.com/GLX. 

Passengers should allow approximately 30 minutes of travel time between North Station and Porter Square utilizing the subway. There will be no direct connection. 

Outbound trains will depart at their scheduled time from Porter Square. Inbound Fitchburg Line trains will terminate at Porter Square where passengers can connect to the Red Line for service to Boston. Passengers desiring outbound Fitchburg Line service from Boston must take the subway to Porter Square for a commuter rail connection.
attributes.header: Weekends, Aug 17-Oct 27, Fitchburg Line service is suspended in both directions between Porter Sq & North Station for Green Line Ext. work. A free subway connection will be provided at Porter Square & N. Station. Normal service will operate on Oct 5-6.
